data.title: Ecer.com launches AI-powered marketplace to reshape global B2B trade, implementing new AI strategy.
data.description: On October 31, 2025, in Beijing, Ecer.com, a prominent mobile B2B marketplace for global trade, announced the introduction of a cutting-edge AI Strategy. This strategic move aims to revolutionize cross-border trade methods by leveraging artificial intelligence technology. Ecer.com, recognized for its global reach, is taking a step towards industry transformation with this new initiative.

data.title: Rocket Travel by Agoda and Skift release Loyalty Value Playbook on Oct. 31, 2025 to improve loyalty programs and close value gap.
data.description: A recently released report by Rocket Travel in partnership with Agoda and Skift outlines a strategy for companies to enhance customer loyalty by bridging the gap between reward redemptions and cash expenditures. The report, published on October 31, 2025, in Singapore, highlights the shifting customer expectations that are redefining conventional loyalty programs. By emphasizing seamless redemption processes and incorporating cash spending opportunities, brands can better meet the evolving needs of consumers.

data.title: Physicians investing in SDIRAs as retirement plan alternative amid $1 million target - Dr. Chin exemplifies.
data.description: In Fort Lauderdale, Florida on October 31, 2025, amid challenges such as inflation, increasing healthcare expenses, and market instability affecting conventional retirement funds, a novel approach is gaining traction. There is a rising trend of doctors and experts turning to Self-Directed IRAs (SDIRAs) to manage their investments and combat these financial hurdles.

data.title: Coinbase CEO expects payments to be next big use case for crypto, citing $40 trillion annually in cross-border payments.
data.description: Brian Armstrong, the CEO of Coinbase Global Inc. (NASDAQ: COIN), predicts that payments will soon emerge as a key focus for the cryptocurrency industry. During Coinbase's recent third-quarter earnings call, Armstrong discussed the potential of stablecoins and Coinbase's role in cross-border payments. He highlighted the massive opportunity in payments, pointing to the $40 trillion in annual cross-border payments, with 75% of it being business-to-business transactions. Armstrong views stablecoins as an early solution for this market. Additionally, he noted the upcoming integration of payment features into the Coinbase retail app. Find the complete story on Benzinga.com.

data.title: Bitcoin anticipates Fed's balance-sheet change, potentially reaching $200,000 as liquidity cycle shifts from quantitative tightening.
data.description: Financial analysts predict that the Federal Reserve's shift away from quantitative tightening may cause Bitcoin to surge to $200,000. They highlight significant distinctions from the situation in 2019 as the basis for their forecast.

data.description: In Washington, the 2025 Winners of the Historic Hotels Worldwide® Annual Awards of Excellence have been announced. Awards include various categories such as #awardsofexcellence.
